About Our Training Program

Executive Education for AI Project Leaders

Our Mission

We exist to equip executives and project managers with practical decision-making skills for the AI era. Through immersive, scenario-based training, we transform how leaders navigate uncertainty, manage competing priorities, and drive successful AI initiatives.

What We Teach

Crisis Management

Navigate real-world AI project emergencies. Learn how to respond to data quality failures, staff resistance, executive pressure, and ethical dilemmas—all within a realistic business context.

Strategic Decision-Making

Develop frameworks for scale/kill decisions on AI initiatives. Evaluate ROI, assess organizational readiness, and make resource allocation decisions with confidence.

Our Methodology

Training is built on three core principles:

1. Realistic Scenarios

Every exercise draws from actual business challenges, complete with emails, data, and stakeholder perspectives that mirror real decision-making environments.

2. Group Collaboration

Learning happens in teams. Participants debate, justify decisions, and learn from diverse perspectives—preparing them for real boardroom discussions.

3. Facilitated Debrief

After each scenario, deep discussion of strategic principles, business trade-offs, and decision frameworks that apply beyond the exercise.

Program Overview

Duration: 4 hours (typically 9am-1pm morning session, or 1:15pm-5:15pm afternoon session)

Participants: 15-30 executives, senior managers, or project leads

Format: In-person facilitated exercises with live discussion and debrief

Session Agenda:
  • Opening (30 min): Role introductions and scenario context setup
  • Crisis Scenarios (80 min): Four 20-minute crisis exercises with 5-minute debriefs
  • Break (15 min)
  • Strategic Decisions (60 min): Scale/Kill case study analysis and group voting
  • Closing Debrief (15 min): Key takeaways and application to your organization

Why This Approach Works

Real Business Context: We use a realistic retail company scenario, not abstract case studies. Participants experience the pressure and complexity of real AI initiatives.

Tested Framework: Our scenarios have been refined through multiple facilitations. We know what works and what generates meaningful discussion.

Immediately Applicable: Participants leave with decision frameworks and mental models they can apply to their own AI portfolio immediately.
